abstract: The F.D.I.C. unanimously approved two sets of rules on Tuesday that would mandate so-called living wills at the nation’s largest financial firms.
snippet: The F.D.I.C. unanimously approved two sets of rules on Tuesday that would mandate so-called living wills at the nation’s largest financial firms.
lead_paragraph: Nearly three years to the day that Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy and Wall Street teetered on the brink, federal regulators are seeking to wipe out the infamous phenomenon that Wall Street is too big to fail.

headline.main: Regulators Aim to End ‘Too Big To Fail’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
